decisionMechanism

Class DistanceCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • decisionMechanism.DistanceCalculator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<DistanceCalculator>

    public class DistanceCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<DistanceCalculator>
    This class calculates the distance between the criteria of two scenarios.

    • Field Summary

      AbstractAlgorithm algorithm
      The compared algorithm
      private int overallDistance
      The sum of all criteria distances between the two scenarios

    • Constructor Detail

      • DistanceCalculator

        public DistanceCalculator(Scenario userScenario,
                  AbstractAlgorithm algorithm)
        Constructor Calculates the initial #overallDistance from the #userScenarioDeepCopy to the #algorithmScenario. Therefore the eucledian distance for each criterion is calculated an the distances from all criteria summed up. Ensures that the same criterion of each scenario is used for the calculation, and not a different criterion.
        Parameters:
        userScenario -
        algorithm -

        public static int eucledianDistance(int a,
                    int b)
        This method calculates the eucledian distance of two criteria.
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        Returns:
        sqrt((a-b)^2)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()

      • update

        public void update(java.lang.String key,
          int oldValue,
          int newValue)
        A criterion of the original user scenario has changed. The calculation needs to be adjusted. new overall distance = old overall distance - old criterion distance + new criterion distance This prevents a recalculation of all criterion distances!
        Parameters:
        key -
        oldValue -
        newValue -
